intro: Coccocypselum pseudotontanea var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-fruited coccocypselum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, glabrous fruiting bodies. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in sandy or disturbed soils. It is a herbaceous species with a sprawling growth habit, and its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized plant in its native habitat.
